intro: Craterispermum goossensii, commonly known as the Goossens' rock rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, and its woody, shrub-like structure. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
